thread.title: Tal’s Hill to remain at Astros’ park for 2016 season
thread.title_full: Tal’s Hill to remain at Astros’ park for 2016 season

author: wtopstaff
title: Tal’s Hill to remain at Astros’ park for 2016 season
text:
Home » News » Sports » MLB » Tal's Hill to remain… Tal’s Hill to remain at Astros’ park for 2016 season By The Associated Press October 15, 2015 6:37 pm FILE - This June 4, 2015 file photo shows the centerfield section and Tal's Hill at Minute Maid Park, home of baseball's Houston Astros. The Houston Astros have postponed a planned renovation of center field at Minute Maid Park that would have removed Tal’s Hill and shortened the distance in center field from 436 to 409 feet, Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015. (AP Photo/Bob Levey, File) 
HOUSTON (AP) — The Astros have postponed a planned renovation of center field at Minute Maid Park that would have removed Tal’s Hill and shortened the distance from the plate from 436 to 409 feet. 
Team president Reid Ryan says that the Astros still plan for the renovations eventually but the construction timelines in the bidding process made clear the project could not be finished by next year’s home opener. 
Houston said its playoff run coupled with an international cricket match in November impacted the construction timelines. 
Houston’s center field is the deepest in the majors, and the $15 million renovation the team announced in June would have made it the sixth-deepest in the majors. Tal’s Hill, a tribute to Cincinnati’s Crosley Field and other old ballparks, is named after former longtime Astros executive Tal Smith. Topics:
